intro: Tamonea lappulacea, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. It has basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its stems are usually unbranched. Tamonea lappulacea is known for its resilience to harsh climatic conditions and is often found in high-altitude habitats.
